intro: Conyza telekii, commonly known as the desert fleabane, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant is typically herbaceous, with small, yellowish to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It has hairy leaves and stems, adapted to withstand drought conditions. Conyza telekii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sandy or rocky habitats.
